metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8383 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
PCRE before 8.38 mishandles certain repeated conditional groups, whichallows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (buffer overflow) orpossibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted regular expression, asdemonstrated by a JavaScript RegExp object encountered by Konqueror.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8383` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpcre3 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1
libpcrecpp0 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1
pcregrep - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: pcre3 package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1').
